page.title: 02POPULATION-TYPE CHANGE
page.content: {POPULATION(APPROX 2000)HAS NOT CHANGED {SINCE 1881 CENSUS.}OCCUPATIONS RANGE FROM INDIGENOUS FARMWORKERS/COMMUTERS TO MIGRANT LOCALLY EMPLOYED/COMMUTERS (NATIONALLY AND INTERNATIONALLY).SOME PENSIONERS HAVE RETIRED INTO THE AREA. {THIS IS A CHANGE SINCE 1939 WHEN THE {PEOPLE IN AREA WERE ALMOST ENTIRELY IN {AGRICULTURE OR IN SERVICE OF THE BIG {HOUSES.}AREA APPEARS UNAFFECTD BY RURAL/URBAN EXCHANGE ,HOWEVER THERE IS AN OLDER POPULATION THAN THERE USED TO BE,NOT SO MANY CHILDREN.{COMMUTERS GO {TO NEARBY TOWNS REIGATE,DORKING AND {CITIES GUILDFORD,LONDON.}A DYNAMIC AND EXCITING COMMUNITY KEEPING THE COUNTRY WAYS IN TACT WHILST KEEPING ABREAST OF THE 20th CENTURY.{YOUTH YEARNS FOR {"TOWN" AMENITIES BUT IS NOT ADVERSELY {AFFECTED BY LACK OF SAME NOR OPPOSED {TO COUNTRY LIFE BY ABSENCE OF SAME. PERSONAL MOBILITY IS GOOD-BIKES / CARS
